Description: Fragment of an undecorated pottery plate; spool-shaped projection on one side of rim outside with small hole punctured through it. Nile silt clay.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Clay analysis showed the piece belongs to the QANN (Naukratis) group (Schlotzhauer 2012, 180).
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (180-1 no. Nau 152, pl. 34.a-c)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IA.31)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4864 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
